markdownRemark.html: UCLA student Charley Kline attempts to transmit the text login to a computer at the Stanford Research Institute over the first link on the ARPANET, which was the precursor to the modern Internet. After the letters l and o are sent the system crashed, making the first message ever sent on the Internet lo. About an hour later, after recovering from the crash, the full text of login is successfully sent.
